title.value: BUGS IN THE DATA: HOW ImageNet MISREPRESENTS BIODIVERSITY
title.justification: The title is clearly stated on the first page of the paper.
title.quote: BUGS IN THE DATA: HOW ImageNet MISREPRESENTS BIODIVERSITY

extractions.description: This paper critically examines the representation of wild animals in the ImageNet-1k dataset, revealing biases and inaccuracies, and discusses the implications of these findings for the use of this dataset in machine learning applications.

type.justification: The paper involves empirical analysis and evaluation of the ImageNet-1k dataset with specific focus on wild animal classes.
type.quote: In the current paper, we analyze the 13,450 images from 269 classes that represent wild animals in the ImageNet-1k validation set, with the participation of expert ecologists.

name.justification: The primary focus of the paper is on the evaluation of a dataset commonly used for image recognition and object detection tasks, which are central topics in computer vision.
name.quote: ImageNet-1k is a dataset often used for benchmarking machine learning (ML) models and evaluating tasks such as image recognition and object detection.

name.justification: The study scrutinizes the geographical and cultural biases inherent in the dataset, reflecting on their impact on machine learning models.
name.quote: We also find that both the wildlife-related labels and images included in ImageNet-1k present significant geographical and cultural biases, as well as ambiguities such as artificial animals, multiple species in the same image, or the presence of humans.

name.justification: The paper evaluates the accuracy and clarity of class definitions and images in the ImageNet-1k dataset.
name.quote: Here, we examine the 269 classes of wild animals in ImageNet-1k, working with expert ecologists to evaluate both the class definitions and the images included in each class.

name.justification: The paper primarily focuses on the ImageNet-1k dataset, using it as the basis for evaluating inaccuracies and biases in the representation of wild animals.
name.quote: ImageNet-1k is a dataset often used for benchmarking machine learning (ML) models and evaluating tasks such as image recognition and object detection.

referenced_paper_title.value: ImageNet: A Large-Scale Hierarchical Image Database
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper introduces the ImageNet dataset, describing its scale and structure, which are fundamental to the current paper's analysis.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The ImageNet Large Scale Visual Recognition Challenge (ILSVRC) dataset, commonly called ImageNet-1k, [20] is a subset of the full ImageNet dataset [8] that is used widely in categorical object recognition (with 32k citations to date).
